title: I think I'm going to uninstall League finally
body: I've been playing now for over a year and I've been putting up with the bullshit that is every game. I've become a toxic human being and I rage over this game, and teammates tilt me beyond belief. In my current life though league takes up about 80% of my spare time, and I need another game to replace it.

>where if they get defeated they only want to get better.

Come from the FGC (not smash that's different) and this is most certainly not the case. It's the exact same as it is here: You have the people who accept the loss, knuckle down and say "you know what, I need to get better". You also have the people who will say it was lag, online tactics, your character, your playstyle, whatever. It's just like league where they'll mark characters off as cheap, easy or just in general bad.

For OP's case, I'd recommend a chill game. Sometimes when I'm stressed I get on WoW and relax for a few hours, just sitting in a capital city and chatting with friends. Or I play something like Stardew Valley/Cities: Skylines where I can just mellow out.

You've been playing for over an year, imagine people like me that have been playing since Season 2... I always liked the game but even I had to quit  after enduring this last season. The overall experience was negative, and if a game has this impact on you there's no point playing, it's meant to be a fun activity.

Sadly Steam Winter Sale just passed, but if you haven't played any of some classics like Dark Souls 1-3, Borderlands (2 is my advice), BioShock, perhaps Undertale if that's your type, etc. You can spend a lot of time with games like these. For games to spend a lot of hours on I'd suggest Warframe. Takes a lot of space, but is worth it IMO.
Just some suggestions ^^

I went to Overwatch and managed to break my addiction. I can’t stress to you guys enough how much quitting League has improved my life. This game isn’t healthy for humans. It’s not even a fun game to play.    
    
I play a lot less video games in general now, but my heart has healed enjoying the non toxic portions of the industry. Quit this game and stay far away. Come back to the forums and help pull more people out of this hell.

I feel the same atm.
I don't now exactly why but I play this game way too much the last months.
I mean i am playing it since years but not like the last season.
I don't do anything else anymore.
Maybe it's because I am close to Diamond and try to reach it with Voli Jungle xD
But this feels almost like an addiction.
And it makes me more and more angry every match when i am close to D5 Promos and the fu*** Botlane is feeding their asses off although i gave them 3 early kills.
I used to be a chill gamer but nowadays i get triggered every match.
Idk what it is. The Elo, the meta.
It's very exhausting.

And some days ago I asked me the question: "would you play game after game after game if there was no ranked ladder?" And the answer was "hell no".
Then I realized that actually i don't play because the matches are so funny. I only play to climb (even in pre-season). That's the only reason why I still play this game.
If they would delete ranked out of this game i would play maybe 1 or 2 games per week. Not 15 games per day.
You really deserve better than a life wasted playing league of legends. It's a children's game. Do something more interesting with your life.

I tried out other 1 vs 1 games. A card game named Elder Scroll Legends. I wanted to try a competitive game where teammates don't hold me back. Guess what? I became a challanger there(Legends rank). If you want competitive to be fun play games solo. Not shitfest where you need to carry 4 feeders against opponents better then you. Fighting games are so much fun as well.

The amount of time you'll have after quitting is insane. You can play so many maps on osu in the time it takes to play 1 game of League of Legends, and the end filling is so much more fullfilling than it is in leauge. in league u feel like u got screwed over.
If you are into BR game try Ring od Elysium. Its top 10 game in peak hours on steam and despite its EA I find it much better than PUBG
